snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo plans to ask legislators for a change in New York State law that would drastically reduce the number of people who could be arrested for marijuana possession as a result of police stops.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo plans to ask legislators for a change in New York State law that would drastically reduce the number of people who could be arrested for marijuana possession as a result of police stops; advocates of such a change say the offense has ensnared tens of thousands of young black and Latino men who are stopped by the New York City police for other reasons but after being instructed to empty their pockets, find themselves charged with a crime.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo plans to ask legislators for a change in New York State law that would drastically reduce the number of people who could be arrested for marijuana possession as a result of police stops.

headline.seo: Cuomo Seeks Cut in Stop-and-Frisk Arrests
headline.main: Cuomo Seeks Cut in Frisk Arrests
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Seeks Cut In Frisk Arrests
